job_title: Nurse Extern/PCT in Terre Haute, IN
cons:
A WHOLE LOT
- rude and lazy nurses (not all, but most of them are on 5E floor), they will go into a room to administer meds, and if the patient says they need to get cleaned up while they are there, the nurses will say let me go get something and sit and wait around in the nurse's station until the patient hits the call light again and get a pct to clean up. And then they will show up to the room to administer the meds. If you ask for help from a nurse they will pretend they didn't hear you, or give you attitude for asking for help. 
- It's a very busy floor, and some pcts (not all) are very rude to other pct's when someone asks for help
- Overall the morale of this floor is trash, would not recommend working here to anyone
- Lastly, I have yet to receive payment for the 2 days of orientation that I attended. I have reached out to the nursing manager twice about it, and still nothing, it's been 8 months....
